poem:
"Labour's Echo in Midlothian Mines"

Under the red brick,
Lady Victoria yawning -
Miners dug loyalty,
hands kissed by coal and soil.

A lament, soft - 
"Everybody voted Labour..."
voiced in echoes,
soot-stained whispers lost 
in the belly of closed pits.

Their vote,
not unlike a ham sandwich -
basic, necessary,
Wrapped in the bitter inevitability 
of their industry's demise.
